org.microbean.settings

Interface ConverterProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Converters
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ConverterProvider
    A provider of appropriately-typed Converter instances, given Class, Type or TypeLiteral instances.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    getConverter(Class), getConverter(TypeLiteral), getConverter(Type)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T> Converter<? extends T> getConverter(Class<T> type)
      Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.
      Converter<?> getConverter(Type type)
      Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.
      default <T> Converter<? extends T> getConverter(TypeLiteral<T> type)
      Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.

    • Method Detail

      • getConverter

        default <T> Converter<? extends T> getConverter(Class<T> type)
        Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        type - a Class describing the conversion type; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the proper type
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if no Converter is available for the supplied type
        See Also:
        getConverter(Type)
        Idempotency:
        Implementations of this method may return different Converter instances over time given the same type.
        Nullability:
        Implementations of this method must never return null.
        Thread Safety:
        Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • getConverter

        default <T> Converter<? extends T> getConverter(TypeLiteral<T> type)
        Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the conversion type
        Parameters:
        type - a TypeLiteral describing the conversion type; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the proper type
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if no Converter is available for the supplied type
        See Also:
        getConverter(Type)
        Idempotency:
        Implementations of this method may return different Converter instances over time given the same type.
        Nullability:
        Implementations of this method must never return null.
        Thread Safety:
        Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • getConverter

        Converter<?> getConverter(Type type)
        Returns a Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the supplied type.

        Implementations of this method must not call either getConverter(Class) or getConverter(TypeLiteral) or undefined behavior may result.

        Parameters:
        type - a Type describing the conversion type; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null Converter capable of converting Values into objects of the proper type
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if no Converter is available for the supplied type
        Idempotency:
        Implementations of this method may return different Converter instances over time given the same type.
        Nullability:
        Implementations of this method must never return null.
        Thread Safety:
        Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
